result.execSummary:
The defendant Trisha A Odya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 54 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution ($5,420) is to be paid to Citizens Bank of Mukwonago.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.
AMENDED 09-14-2015:  An additional amount of $135.98 is ordered.  To be paid to Sandra P. as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with any of the victims, Citizens Bank of Mukwonago and David or Diane P.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Ignition interlock device installes for the period of probation.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 60 DAYS:  Non-working hours (Huber) with Standard Release Conditions.
Commencing FORTHWITH.
LAST 90 DAYS:  STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Trisha A Odya in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Nicole M Masnica.    

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's Grandmother presented statements to the court.
Defendant's Mother presented statements to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:   2 Years.
54 Days Credit
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2 Years
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victims Citizens Bank of Mukwonago and David or Diane Pfeiffer.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

RESTITUTION:  $5,420 (to be paid to Citizens Bank of Mukwonago - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs: $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME: 
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to be transferred to Huber - Forthwith.
Last 90 Days - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
